column3: Rebased now that #11771 has been merged.\n\nedit: Just realised that I have't addressed Russ's comment here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11817#discussion_r158134976. Will do that later
ok, properly rebased and Russ's comment addressed.
Added small nits, but ACK.
utACK 96b02a0f62a64819c0048357b9e8b9da91af195f

@conscott thanks for the review. I agree that `int(hash, 16)` is better, but I'll leave that change out of this PR. The main aim is to change this test to use the BitcoinTestFramework. We can address further nits in a future PR.
Needs rebase in the commit that moves the methods. Sorry for letting this sit for so long.
> Sorry for letting this sit for so long.\n\nNot a problem. This is low priority, will rebase next week.
Rebased. Also addressed @conscott's comments: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11817#discussion_r168810760 in the first commit.
Concept ACK, and very weak utACK (read through the changes, not a Python expert).
re-utACK 12982682a602ee656ce74b5733747a05d70907f8 only changes were style changes that shouldn't change behaviour.

In commit "Remove nested loops from bip68-112-113-p2p.py"

Should be able to avoid a lookup with [tx['tx'] for tx in txs.values()]

In commit "Remove nested loops from bip68-112-113-p2p.py"\n\nIt seems better to continue returning a list than a dictionary. A dictionary is just slower and introduces nondeterminism in the test for no reason.
Yes, that's better. Fixed
yes - returning a list is much better. Changed. Thanks
To go along with @ryanofsky  earlier comments in related PRs. This can be simplified to `int(hash,16)`
Same here. Can be `int(hash,16)`
In commit c5427d1f4e3652a1b55968c752fb362b31996186\n\nThe "flags" to indicate if the random high- or low-bit was set are never read. Might as well not include it in the object.
Same here
In commit c5427d1f4e3652a1b55968c752fb362b31996186:\n\nAny reason you remove the trailing comments in all lines but not in this one?
In commit cb5b047a6f6fb58afee:\n\nNit: Sometimes you use named args for the bool, and sometimes you don't. Might as well use the `success=False` everywhere.
sounds good. Updated.
I missed this one. Now removed.
Yep, good spot. I've removed the 'srhb' and 'srlb' keys.
fixed as above
